glsa.title: PostgreSQL: Local privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: The PostgreSQL server can be tricked by a local attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: PostgreSQL is a SQL compliant, open source object-relational database management system.

description.p: PostgreSQL's LOAD extension is vulnerable to a local privilege escalation discovered by John Heasman. A local user can load any shared library, but the initialization function will then be executed with the permissions of the PostgreSQL server.

impact.p: A malicious local user could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the PostgreSQL server.

workaround.p: There is no know workaround at this time.
